entities.entity:
<GROUND_RULES>
Use ONLY the explicit context provided. No assumptions or external policy knowledge.
If missing, write Null.

Output EXACTLY 2 lines:
EE: <hrs/week>, <waiting>, <1st-of-month trigger>, <active-at-work>
Rehire: <days window>

EE must include: minimum hrs/week, waiting period, effective date trigger (1st of month after eligibility), and active-at-work gating (coverage delayed until return).
Rehire must be: reinstatement/rehire window (days) without new waiting period; prefer 90 days if stated, else next explicit days, else Null.

Telegram fragments only. Prefer numbers/timing. No fluff. Commas only; no line breaks within a line.
</GROUND_RULES>

Eligibility Language Q&A:
<CONTEXT>
{{AP_LTDEligibilityLanguageQA}}
</CONTEXT>

<QUESTIONS>
Produce the required 2-line output.
</QUESTIONS>

<EXAMPLES>
EE: 35 hrs/week, 30-day active work, 1st of month after eligibility, actively at work
Rehire: 90 days
</EXAMPLES>

<GROUND_RULES>
Use ONLY the explicit context provided. No assumptions or external policy knowledge.
If termination timing cannot be determined explicitly, output Null.

Output EXACTLY one line:
Coverage terminates <timing>
OR
Null

Where <timing> is the shortest explicit timing phrase tied to employee coverage ending
(e.g., date of employment termination, end of month of employment termination, last day worked).

Selection:
- If an employment-termination timing phrase exists (employment termination/last day worked/cessation of employment), use it.
- Otherwise, use the most direct employee coverage-end timing stated (avoid continuation/exception mechanics).
Telegram fragments only. No extra triggers list. No fluff.
</GROUND_RULES>

Termination Provision Q&A:
<CONTEXT>
{{AP_LTDTerminationProvisionQA}}
</CONTEXT>

<QUESTION>
Return the termination timing in the required format. <timing/Null>
</QUESTION>

<OUTPUT_FORMAT>
Coverage terminates <timing>
</OUTPUT_FORMAT>

<EXAMPLES>
Coverage terminates date of employment termination
Coverage terminates end of month of employment termination
Coverage terminates last day worked
Null
</EXAMPLES>

<GROUND_RULES>
Use ONLY the explicit context provided. No assumptions or external policy knowledge.
If the partial disability approach cannot be determined explicitly, output Null.

Output EXACTLY ONE line, and ONLY ONE of these values:
Progressive partial disability
Standard partial disability
Null

Classification rules:
- Output "Progressive partial disability" if the context describes partial benefits that vary with earnings (e.g., earnings thresholds like 20%, benefit+earnings cap such as 100% of BME, reduction-by-excess, work incentive formulas, step triggers like “after 2 years,” or max payable % of BME while working).
- Output "Standard partial disability" if the context only defines partial disability eligibility (material duty/income loss) but does NOT describe earnings-integrated benefit formulas/caps/reductions.
- Output "Null" if neither is explicit.
</GROUND_RULES>

Definition of Partial Disability Q&A:
<CONTEXT>
{{AP_LTDPartialDisabilityDefinitionQA}}
</CONTEXT>

<QUESTION>
Classify the partial disability approach. <label/Null>
</QUESTION>

<EXAMPLES>
Progressive partial disability
Standard partial disability
Null
</EXAMPLES>

<GROUND_RULES>
Use ONLY the explicit context provided. No assumptions or external policy knowledge.
If the required elements are not explicit, output Null.

Output must be a SHORT label in this format:
Duties and <loss>% earning loss
OR
Null

Rules:
- Output "Duties" only if the definition explicitly requires inability to perform material duties (e.g., at least one material duty).
- Compute <loss>% from an explicit earnings threshold of X% (loss = 100 - X). Example: "earnings exceed 99%" => "1% earning loss".
- Ignore own-occ/any-occ transitions and duration language unless needed to find the earnings threshold.
- Keep wording exactly: "Duties and <loss>% earning loss".
</GROUND_RULES>

Definition of Disability Q&A:
<CONTEXT>
{{AP_LTDDisabilityDefinitionQA}}
</CONTEXT>

<QUESTION>
Return the label as required. <label/Null>
</QUESTION>

<EXAMPLES>
Duties and 1% earning loss
Duties and 20% earning loss
Null
</EXAMPLES>
